definitions: To watch carefully the way something happens or someone does something, especially in order to learn more about it.
To notice or perceive something and register it as being significant.
To make a remark or comment.
To obey a law, rule, or custom.
To celebrate or honor a holiday or ritual.
examples: She observes the stars every night.
He observes that the market is changing.
The company observes all safety regulations.
The family observes Thanksgiving with a large dinner.
